"he was mentioned at Her Majesty's and you were pitied. . . ." 
The prince answered nothing, but she 
looked at him significantly, awaiting a reply. He frowned. 
"What would you have me do?" he said at last. "You know I did all a father could for their education, and they have both turned out fools. Hippolyte is at least a quiet fool, but Anatole is an active one. That is the only dif- ference between them." He said this smiling in a way more natural and animated than usual, so that the wrink
